page.title: 04Geology and development
page.content: The village of Middlezoy is built on rising ground formed by the intrusion of blue lias rock through the surrounding peat and sand layers of Sedgemoor. This is part of a ridge of rock on which the villages of Chedzoy, Westonzoyland, Middlezoy, Middlezoy and Othery lie; the whole area being known as the island of Sowey. The highest point in Middlezoy (Windmill Hill) is only 30m above the surrounding moor which is at, or just below, sea level. Over the years Middlezoy has expanded little, and although during the last 40 years approximately 60 houses have been built, these are all within the old village boundaries, having been built on old orchards, farmyards etc. as infill.
